entry.title: Cyclic bases of zero-curvature representations: further examples
entry.summary: The paper continues nlin.SI/0212019 by giving three more examples of using cyclic bases of zero-curvature representations in studies of relation between strong Lax pairs and recursion operators.

entry.title: Zero curvature representation for a new fifth-order integrable system
entry.summary: In this brief note we present a zero-curvature representation for one of the new integrable system found by Mikhailov, Novikov and Wang in nlin.SI/0601046.

entry.title: Finite-genus solutions for the Hirota's bilinear difference equation
entry.summary: The finite-genus solutions for the Hirota's bilinear difference equation are constructed using the Fay's identities for the theta-functions of compact Riemann surfaces.

entry.title: Painleve Analysis in Superspace
entry.summary: A method for carrying out the Painleve test in superspace is proposed. The method is then applied to the one-parameter N=1 supersymmetric extensions of the KdV equation.

entry.title: R-matrix for asymmetrical XXZ spin chain in magnetic field
entry.summary: The R-matrix for asymmetrical XXZ spin chain in magnetic field is presented. It depends non-additively on two spectral parameters.

entry.title: Ising Model Scaling Functions at Short Distance
entry.summary: A method for proving the Luther-Peschel formula for the short distance asymptotics of the Ising model scaling functions is sketched.

author.name: John Palmer
author.arxiv:affiliation: Department of Mathematics University of Arizona

entry.title: Master Integrals, Superintegrability and Quadratic Algebras
entry.summary: In this paper we use a generalization of Oevel's theorem about master symmetries to relate them with superintegrability and quadratic algebras.

entry.title: Extension of the discrete KP hierarchy
entry.summary: We introduce the discrete hierarchy which naturally generalizes well known discrete KP hierarchy.

entry.title: Darboux transformation for the modified Veselov-Novikov equation
entry.summary: A Darboux transformation is constructed for the modified Veselov-Novikov equation.

entry.title: On generalized Lotka-Volterra lattices
entry.summary: Generalized matrix Lotka-Volterra lattice equations are obtained in a systematic way from a "master equation" possessing a bicomplex formulation.

entry.title: Parasupersymmetric structure of the Boussinesq-type systems
entry.summary: We study Darboux transformations for a Boussinesq-type equations. The parasupersymmetric structure of link between Boussinesq and modified Boussinesq systems is revealed.

entry.title: On dispersionless coupled modified KP hierarchy
entry.summary: We define and study dispersionless coupled modified KP hierarchy, which incorporates two different versions of dispersionless modified KP hierarchies.

entry.title: The scattering approach for the Camassa-Holm equation
entry.summary: We present an approach proving the integrability of the Camassa--Holm equation for initial data of small amplitude.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: J. Nonlinear Math. Phys., volume 9, no.4 (2002) 389-393

entry.title: Three Dimensional Integrable Mappings
entry.summary: We derive three-dimensional integrable mappings which have two invariants.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, part of this paper is taken from the author's PhD thesis, not submitted for publication

entry.title: On Whitham's Averaging Method
entry.summary: We compare Whitham averaging method using Lagrangian and Hamiltonian formalism.

entry.title: Two twistor descriptions of the isomonodromy problem
entry.summary: The connections between Hitchin and Mason's twistor descriptions of the isomonodromy problem are explored.

entry.title: A cohomological construction of integrable hierarchies of hydrodynamic type
entry.summary: We explain how to use the theory of bidifferential ideals to construct integrable hierarchies of hydrodynamic type.

entry.title: New Cellular Automata associated with the Schroedinger Discrete Spectral Problem
entry.summary: New Cellular Automata associated with the Schroedinger discrete spectral problem are derived. These Cellular Automata possess an infinite (countable) set of constants of motion.

entry.title: On a new integrable nonlinear Schroedinger equation with a simple external potential and its explicit solutions
entry.summary: A nonlinear Schr\"odinger equation with external potential $-(t+b)^{-1}$ is considered and its explicit solutions are constructed.

entry.title: Modified dispersionless Veselov--Novikov equations and corresponding hydrodynamic chains
entry.summary: Various links connecting well-known hydrodynamic chains and corresponding 2+1 nonlinear equations are described.

entry.title: The method of solving of nonlinear Schrödinger equation
entry.summary: The method of solving of nonlinear Schr\"odinger equation is considered. Some examples of its applications are demonstrated.

author.name: Dmitry Levko
author.arxiv:affiliation: Institute of Physics National Ukrainian Academy of Sciences

entry.title: On dual equation in theory of the second order ODE's
entry.summary: The relations between the second order ODE's cubical on the first derivative and their dual equations are discussed

entry.title: Integrable Nonautonomous Nonlinear Schrodinger Equations
entry.summary: We show that a recently given nonautonomous nonlinear Schrodinger equation (NLSE) can be transformed into the autonomous NLSE.

entry.title: On the Equations of Nonstationary Transonic Gas Flows
entry.summary: The method of point transformation of the functions and variables for construction of particular solutions of the Equations of Nonstationary Transonic Gas Flows is used.

entry.title: Remarks on the waterbag model of dispersionless Toda Hierarchy
entry.summary: We construct the free energy associated with the waterbag model of dToda. Also, the relations of conserved densities are investigated

entry.title: On geometry of gonometric family of cycles
entry.summary: An examples of solutions of the equation for curvature of congruence of cycles are constructed. Their properties are discussed.

entry.title: Integrability of the Gibbons--Tsarev system
entry.summary: A new approach extracting multi-parametric hydrodynamic reductions for the integrable hydrodynamic chains is presented. The Benney hydrodynamic chain is considered.

entry.title: The Sato Grassmannian and the CH hierarchy
entry.summary: We discuss how the Camassa-Holm hierarchy can be framed within the geometry of the Sato Grassmannian.

entry.title: Towards the theory of Benney equations
entry.summary: Particular solutions of the Benney equations are constructed. Their properties are discussed.

entry.title: The Cauchy problem of the Ward equation with mixed scattering data
entry.summary: We solve the Cauchy problem of the Ward equation with both continuous and discrete scattering data.

entry.title: Auto-Backlund Transformation for the r-th Double Modified Dispersionless Kadomtsev-Petviashvili Equation
entry.summary: We find auto-Backlund transformation for the r-th double modified dispersionless Kadomtsev--Petviashvili equation.

entry.title: Hyperdeterminant and an integrable partial differential equation
entry.summary: We discuss an integrable partial differential equation arising from the hyperdeterminant.

entry.title: Self-similar solutions of the Burgers hierarchy
entry.summary: Self-similar solutions of the equations for the Burgers hierarchy are presented.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Applied Mathematics and Computation, 2009, V. 215, P. 1990-1993

entry.title: A fifth-order bi-Hamiltonian system
entry.summary: In this work, we introduce a new two component fifth-order bi-Hamiltonian sys- tem admitting the scalar Kupershmidt equation as a reduction.

entry.title: Reply to Professor Yehia comments arXiv:1305.0026
entry.summary: This is a reply to Professor Yehia Comments in arXiv:1305.0026

entry.title: Recursion operator for a system admitting Lax representation with non-rational Lax function
entry.summary: A recursion operator is constructed for a hydrodynamic type system admitting dispersionless Lax representation with non-rational Lax function.

entry.title: Tensor fields defined by Lax representations
entry.summary: In this paper, some properties of tensor fields constructed by the Lax representation of chiral-type systems are investigated.

entry.title: Bäcklund transformations between four Lax-integrable 3D equations
entry.summary: We show that four Lax-integrable 3D differential equations are related via B\"acklund transformations.

entry.title: Recursion operators of the N=2 supersymmetric unconstrained matrix GNLS hierarchies
entry.summary: A super-algebraic formulation of the N=2 supersymmetric unconstrained matrix (k|n,m)-MGNLS hierarchies (nlin.SI/0201026) is established. Recursion operators, fermionic and bosonic symmetries as well as their superalgebra are constructed for these hierarchies.

entry.title: Deformations of plane algebraic curves and integrable systems of hydrodynamic type
entry.summary: We describe our recent work on deformations of hyperelliptic curves by means of integrable hierarchy of hydrodynamic type (nlin.SI/0205012). We also discuss a further extension to the case of non-hyperelliptic curves.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, Submitted for the WSPC Proceedings of Gallipoli workshop July 26 - Aug. 6, 2002

entry.title: Lagrangian multiform structure for the lattice KP system
entry.summary: We present a Lagrangian for the bilinear discrete KP (or Hirota-Miwa) equation. Furthermore, we show that this Lagrangian can be extended to a Lagrangian 3-form when embedded in a higher dimensional lattice, obeying a closure relation. Thus we establish the multiform structure as proposed in arXiv:0903.4086v1 [nlin.SI] in a higher dimensional case.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages, submitted to J. Phys. A: Math. Theor

entry.title: N=2 supersymmetric unconstrained matrix GNLS hierarchies are consistent
entry.summary: We develop a pseudo-differential approach to the N=2 supersymmetric unconstrained matrix (k|n,m)-Generalized Nonlinear Schroedinger hierarchies and prove consistency of the corresponding Lax-pair representation (nlin.SI/0201026). Furthermore, we establish their equivalence to the integrable hierarchies derived in the super-algebraic approach of the homogeneously-graded loop superalgebra sl(2k+n|2k+m)\otimes C[{lambda},{lambda}^{-1}] (nlin.SI/0206037). We introduce an unconventional definition of N=2 supersymmetric strictly pseudo-differential operators so as to close their algebra among themselves.

entry.title: BC_n Ruijsenaars-Schneider models: R-Matrix structure and hamiltonians
entry.summary: This paper is replaced and superseded by nlin.SI/0106015 (Title: Structures in BC_N Ruijsenaars-Schneider models)

entry.title: Reductions of the Volterra and Toda chains
entry.summary: The Volterra and Toda chains equations are considered. A class of special reductions for these equations are derived.

entry.title: Deriving N-soliton solutions via constrained flows
entry.summary: The soliton equations can be factorized by two commuting x- and t-constrained flows. We propose a method to derive N-soliton solutions of soliton equations directly from the x- and t-constrained flows.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, AmsTex, no figures, to be published in Journal of Physics A

entry.title: On dbar-problem and integrable equations
entry.summary: Using the dbar-problem and dual dbar-problem, we derive bilinear relations which allows us to construct integrable hierarchies in different parametrizations, their Darboux-B\"{a}cklund transformations and to analyze constraints for them ina very simple way. Scalar KP, BKP and CKP hierarchies are considered as examples.

entry.title: Integrability of V. Adler's discretization of the Neumann system
entry.summary: We prove the integrability of the discretization of the Neumann system recently proposed by V. Adler.

entry.title: Derivation of R-matrix from local Hamiltonian density
entry.summary: A computer algebra algoritm for solving the quantum Yang-Baxter equation is presented. It is based on the Taylor expansion of R-matrix which is developed up to the order \lambda^6. As an example the classification of 4x4 R-matrices is given.

entry.title: Conservation laws for the nonlinear Schrodinger equation in Miwa variables
entry.summary: A compact expression for the generating function of the constants of motion for the nonlinear Schrodinger equation is derived using the functional representation of the AKNS hierarchy.

entry.title: Abelian solitons
entry.summary: We describe a new algebraically completely integrable system, whose integral manifolds are co-elliptic subvarieties of Jacobian varieties. This is a multi-periodic extension of the Krichever-Treibich-Verdier system, which consists of elliptic solitons.

entry.title: A new C-integrable limit of SHG equations
entry.summary: A new C-integrable limit of the second harmonic generation equations is found. The corresponding general solution is given in an explicit form. Connection of this problem with the modified Liouville equation is discussed.

entry.title: A study on the fourth q-Painlevé equation
entry.summary: A q-difference analogue of the fourth Painlev\'e equation is proposed. Its symmetry structure and some particular solutions are investigated.

entry.title: A Determinant Formula for a Class of Rational Solutions of Painlevé V Equation
entry.summary: We give an explicit determinant formula for a class of rational solutions of the Painlev\'e V equation in terms of the universal characters.

entry.title: Inverse moment problem for elementary co-adjoint orbits
entry.summary: We give a solution to the inverse moment problem for a certain class of Hessenberg and symmetric matrices related to integrable lattices of Toda type.

entry.title: Short Distance Asymptotics of Ising Correlation
entry.summary: The short distance asymptotics of the Ising Model scaling functions are computed for the scaling functions that arise as continuum limits of lattice correlations from below the critical temperature.

author.name: John Palmer
author.arxiv:affiliation: Department of Mathematics University of Arizona

entry.title: Bilinearization of Supersymmetric KP Hierarchies Associated with Non-Trivial Flows
entry.summary: We show that the supersymmetric KdV and KP equations, related to the non-trivial flows, can be cast in the Hirota bilinear form. The existence of one, two and subsequently $N$-soliton solutions is explicitly demonstrated.

entry.title: n-th discrete KP hierarchy
entry.summary: We report an infinite class of discrete hierarchies which naturally generalize familiar discrete KP one.
entry.arxiv:comment: LaTeX, 6 pages, talk given at the Fourth International Conference "Symmetry in Nonlinear Mathematical Physics" held in Kiev, 09-15.07.2001

entry.title: On the Rational Solutions of q-Painlevé V Equation
entry.summary: We give an explicit determinant formula for a class of rational solutions of a q-analogue of the Painlev\'e V equation. The entries of the determinant are given by the continuous q-Laguerre polynomials.

entry.title: A Characterization of Discrete Time Soliton Equations
entry.summary: We propose a method to characterize discrete time evolution equations, which generalize discrete time soliton equations, including the $q$-difference Painlev\'e IV equations discussed recently by Kajiwara, Noumi and Yamada.

entry.title: Multicomponent bi-superHamiltonian KdV systems
entry.summary: It is shown that a new class of classical multicomponent super KdV equations is bi-superHamiltonian by extending the method for the verification of graded Jacobi identity. The multicomponent extension of super mKdV equations is obtained by using the super Miura transformation.

entry.title: Lax pair for the Adler (lattice Krichever-Novikov) System
entry.summary: In the paper [V. Adler, IMRN {\bf 1} (1998) 1--4] a lattice version of the Krichever-Novikov equation was constructed. We present in this note its Lax pair and discuss its elliptic form.

entry.title: Spiral-Logarithmic Structure in a Heisenberg Ferromagnet
entry.summary: Spiral-logarithmic structure is suggested as a stationary solution of a modified equation for the Heisenberg model, and the single- and N-soliton solutions are constructed on this base.

entry.title: A note on the modified KP hierarchy and its (yet another) dispersionless limit
entry.summary: The modified KP hierarchies of Kashiwara and Miwa is formulated in Lax formalism by Dickey. Their solutions are parametrised by flag varieties. Its dispersionless limit is considered.

entry.title: How to solve Yang-Baxter equation using the Taylor expansion of R-matrix
entry.summary: A new method for solving the Yang-Baxter equation is presented. It is based on the Taylor expansion of R-matrix which is developed up to the power lambda^6. Using this method the R-matrix for integrable spin ladder is calculated.

entry.title: On a Functional Equation of Ruijsenaars
entry.summary: We obtain the general solution of the functional equation introduced by Ruijsenaars guaranteeing the commutativity of n operators associated with the quantum Ruijsenaars-Schneider models.

entry.title: Non-autonomous Degenerate KdV Systems
entry.summary: Non-autonomous degenerate KdV systems in (1+1) dimensions are considered for integrability classification. Integrability of the systems is associated with the existence of a recursion operator. Some new non-autonomous degenerate two-component KdV systems are found.

entry.title: Integrable deformations of systems on graphs with loops
entry.summary: We find necessary and sufficient conditions for an operator of the fourth order on a graph with loops to admit the (L,A,B)-triple Krichever-Novikov deformation of one energy level.

entry.title: Fractional Logistic Map
entry.summary: A new type of an integrable mapping is presented. This map is equipped with fractional difference and possesses an exact solution, which can be regarded as a discrete analogue of the Mittag-Leffler function.

entry.title: Real-Valued Algebro-Geometric Solutions of the Camassa--Holm hierarchy
entry.summary: We provide a treatment of real-valued, smooth, and bounded algebro-geometric solutions of the Camassa--Holm (CH) hierarchy and describe the associated isospectral torus. We also discuss real-valued algebro-geometric solutions with a cusp behavior.

entry.title: Ladder Operators for Integrable One-Dimensional Lattice Models
entry.summary: A generalised ladder operator is used to construct the conserved operators for any model derived from the Yang-Baxter equation. As an example, the low order conserved operators for the XYh model are calculated explicitly.

entry.title: New Integrable Family in the n-Dimensional Homogeneous Lotka-Volterra Systems with Abelian Lie Algebra
entry.summary: We present an n-dimensional integrable homogeneous Lotka--Volterra system, which has $(n^2-1)$-dimensional Lie symmetry algebra. Moreover a wider integrable family is derived from the structure of the Lie algebra.

entry.title: The Baecklund transformation equations for the ultradiscrete KP equation
entry.summary: The Baecklund transformation for the ultradiscrete KP equation is proposed. An algorithm to eliminate variables from the ultradiscrete linear equations is proposed. The consistency condition for the Baecklund transformation equations is obtained via the algorithm.

entry.title: A new class of linearizable equations
entry.summary: Using the symmetry approach, we find a class of integrable nonlinear PDEs with dispersion law $\omega(k)=k^{\frac32}$. All these equations turn out to be linearizable by means of a differential parametrization.

entry.title: Integrable hydrodynamic chains
entry.summary: A new approach for derivation of Benney-like momentum chains and integrable hydrodynamic type systems is presented. New integrable hydrodynamic chains are constructed, all their reductions are described and integrated. New (2+1) integrable hydrodynamic type systems are found.

entry.title: Painleve test and higher order differential equations
entry.summary: Starting from the second Painlev\'{e} equation, we obtain Painlev\'{e} type equations of higher order by using the singular point analysis.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: J. Nonlinear Math. Phys., volume 9, no. 3 (2002) 282-310

entry.title: Some notes on Ishimori's magnet model
entry.summary: Gauge transformation properties for an associated linear system of model Ishimori's magnet model have been discussed. Explicit formulas for the gauge transformation matrix have been obtained. Darboux Transformation has been suggested and appropriate dressing relations have been found.

entry.title: Classical transcendental solutions of the Painlevé equations and their degeneration
entry.summary: We present a determinant expression for a family of classical transcendental solutions of the Painlev\'e V and the Painlev\'e VI equation. Degeneration of these solutions along the process of coalescence for the Painlev\'e equations is discussed.

entry.title: On Treves' Algebraic Characterization of the KdV Hierarchy
entry.summary: We have found a possibility to streamline the proof of the Treves' theorem (Duke Math. J., 108, 251-295, 2001) on an algebraic characterization of the KdV hierarchy which makes it significantly shorter, following essentially the logic of the original proof.

entry.title: Real Jacobian Elliptic Function Parametrizations for a Genuinely Asymmetric Biquadratic Curve
entry.summary: We give real Jacobian elliptic function parametrizations for a genuinely asymmetric biquadratic curve where the variables and parameters are real.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, 1 figure, 1 table, part of this paper is taken from the author's PhD thesis, not submitted for publication

entry.title: Integrable mappings derived from the $ΔΔRsG$ equation
entry.summary: In this paper we consider the integrability of the mappings derived from the double discrete related sine-Gordon $(\Delta \Delta RsG)$ equation, which we recently introduced in the paper Higher dimensional integrable mappings, under an appropriate periodicity condition.

entry.title: Fourier form of the dressing method: simple example of integrable (2+1)-dimensional integral-differential equation
entry.summary: We represent the Fourier form of the dressing method, which is effective for construction of multidimensional integral-differential equations together with their solutions. Example of integrable (but non-physical) expansion of Intermediate Long Wave equation in (2+1)-dimensions is considered.

entry.title: On the Deformations of Dorfman's and Sokolov's Operators
entry.summary: We deform the Dorfman's and Sokolov's Hamiltonian operators by the quasi-Miura transformation coming from the topological field theory and investigate the deformed operators.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, Contribution to the Proceedings of the Fifth International Conference " Symmetry in Nonlinear Mathematical Physics", Kyiv, Ukraine, June, 2003

entry.title: The geometry of dual isomonodromic deformations
entry.summary: The JMMS equations are studied using the geometry of the spectral curve of a pair of dual systems. It is shown that the equations can be represented as time-independent Hamiltonian flows on a Jacobian bundle.

entry.title: Hydrodynamic reductions and solutions of a universal hierarchy
entry.summary: The diagonal hydrodynamic reductions of a hierarchy of integrable hydrodynamic chains are explicitly characterized. Their compatibility with previously introduced reductions of differential type is analyzed and their associated class of hodograph solutions is discussed.

entry.title: On Separation of Variables for Homogeneous SL(r) Gaudin Systems
entry.summary: By means of a recently introduced bihamiltonian structure for the homogeneous Gaudin models, we find a new set of Separation Coordinates for the sl(r) case.

entry.title: Convenient parameterizations of matrices in terms of vectors
entry.summary: Convenient parameterizations of matrices in terms of vectors transform (certain classes of) matrix equations into covariant (hence rotation-invariant) vector equations. Certain recently introduced such parameterizations are tersely reviewed, and new ones introduced.

entry.title: Integrable Quasiclassical Deformations of Algebraic Curves
entry.summary: A general scheme for determining and studying integrable deformations of algebraic curves is presented. The method is illustrated with the analysis of the hyperelliptic case. An associated multi-Hamiltonian hierarchy of systems of hydrodynamic type is characterized.

entry.title: Reductions of the Volterra lattice
entry.summary: We exhibit three classes of algebraic constraints which are shown compatible with Volterra lattice.
entry.arxiv:comment: Latex, 9 pages, accepted for publication in Physics Letters A

entry.title: Constructing a Supersymmetric Integrable System from the Hirota Method in Superspace
entry.summary: An N=1 supersymmetric system is constructed and its integrability is shown by obtaining three soliton solutions for it using the supersymmetric version of Hirota's direct method.

entry.title: Extended discrete KP hierarchy and its dispersionless limit
entry.summary: We exhibit the dispersionless limit of the extended discrete KP hierarchy.

entry.title: On integrable system on $S^2$ with the second integral quartic in the momenta
entry.summary: We consider integrable system on the sphere $S^2$ with an additional integral of fourth order in the momenta. At the special values of parameters this system coincides with the Kowalevski-Goryachev-Chaplygin system.

entry.title: The Boussinesq equation and Miura type transformations
entry.summary: A direct method for calculation of Miura type transformations via LA pair is used for the Boussinesq equation. Quadratic Miura type transformations connected with local weakly-nonlocal (Maltsev-Novikov) Hamiltonian structures. Modified systems are presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: to appear in Journal of Mathematical Sciences

entry.title: On continual classes of evolution equations
entry.summary: We reproduce our old result on the complete class of local evolution equations admitting the original Miura transformation, and then consider this continual class of evolution equations from the standpoint of zero-curvature representations.

entry.title: Elementary Darboux transformations and factorization
entry.summary: A general theorem on factorization of matrices with polynomial entries is proven and it is used to reduce polynomial Darboux matrices to linear ones. Some new examples of linear Darboux matrices are discussed.

entry.title: Discrete Toda field equations
entry.summary: Discrete analogs of the finite and affine Toda field equations are found corresponding to the Lie algebras of series $C_N$ and $\tilde{C_N}$. Their Lax pairs are represented.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages, submitted to Teor. Math. Phys

entry.title: On Justification of Gibbs Distribution
entry.summary: The paper develop a new approach to the justification of Gibbs canonical distribution for Hamiltonian systems with finite number of degrees of freedom. It uses the condition of nonintegrability of the ensemble of weak interacting Hamiltonian systems.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Regular and Chaotic Dynamics, 2002 Volume 7 Number 1

entry.title: Integrable Systems and Discrete Geometry
entry.summary: This is an expository article for Elsevier's Encyclopedia of Mathematical Physics on the subject in the title. Comments/corrections welcome.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Encyclopedia of Mathematical Physics, Vol. III, pp. 78-87, Elsevier, 2006

entry.title: On a transformation between hierarchies of integrable equations
entry.summary: A transforation between a hierarchy of integrable equations arising from the standard $R$-matrix construction on the algebra of differential operators and a hierarchy of integrable equations arising from a deformation of the standard $R$-matrix is given.

entry.title: Trigonometric Lax matrix for the Kowalevski gyrostat on so(4)
entry.summary: We present trigonometric Lax matrix and classical $r$-matrix for the Kowalevski gyrostat on $so(4)$ algebra by using auxiliary matrix algebras $so(3,2)$ or $sp(4)$.

entry.title: Darboux Transformation for the Non-stationary Shrödinger Equation
entry.summary: The Lax representation for the nonstationary Schr\"odinger equation with rather arbitrary potential is proposed. Some examples of the construction of exact solutions are given by means of Darboux Transformation method.

entry.title: Hamiltonian formalism of the DNLS equation with nonvanished boundary value
entry.summary: Hamiltonian formalism of the DNLS equation with nonvanishing boundary value is developed by the standard procedure.

entry.title: Lax Representation of WZNW-Like Systems
entry.summary: The Lax representation and Backlund transformations for the systems similar to WZNW (Wess-Zumino-Novicov-Witten) systems and non-abelian affine Toda models are obtained in present paper. One of these systems is a new integrable extension of well known sine-Gordon equation.

entry.title: Supersymmetric Two-Boson Equation: Bilinearization and Solutions
entry.summary: A bilinear formulation for the supersymmetric two-boson equation is derived. As applications, some solutions are calculated for it. We also construct a bilinear Backlund transformation.

entry.title: An exact solution to a kth order, nth degree nonlinear differential equation
entry.summary: An explicit analytic solution to the nonlinear differential equation d^k y (--) ^n = y^l dx^kk is obtained for arbitrary integer values of k, l and n.

entry.title: Noether Symmetries and Critical Exponents
entry.summary: We show that all Lie point symmetries of various classes of nonlinear differential equations involving critical nonlinearities are variational/divergence symmetries.
entry.arxiv:comment: Published in SIGMA (Symmetry, Integrability and Geometry: Methods and Applications) at http://www.emis.de/journals/SIGMA/

entry.title: Laplace Invariants of Toda Lattices with the Exceptional Cartan Matrices
entry.summary: We show that Toda lattices with the exceptional Cartan matrices are Liouville type systems. For these systems of equations, we obtain explicit formulas for the invariants and generalized Laplace invariants.

entry.title: Fixed Energy R-separation for Schroedinger equation
entry.summary: We extend the classical approach of the R-separation of the Laplace equation (as a null eigenvalue problem) to the general steady state Schroedinger equation including cases where a scalar potential V is present and the energy is a fixed constant.

entry.title: Extended Camassa-Holm Hierarchy and Conserved Quantities
entry.summary: An extension of the Camassa-Holm hierarchy is constructed in this letter. The conserved quantities of the hierarchy are studied and a recurrent formula for the integrals of motion is derived.

entry.title: Solutions of Non-Integrable Equations by the Hirota Direct Method
entry.summary: We show that we can also apply the Hirota method to some non-integrable equations. For this purpose, we consider the extensions of the Kadomtsev-Petviashvili (KP) and the Boussinesq (Bo) equations. We present several solutions of these equations.

entry.title: Dressing chain for the acoustic spectral problem
entry.summary: The iterations are studied of the Darboux transformation for the generalized Schroedinger operator. The applications to the Dym and Camassa-Holm equations are considered.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Theoretical and Mathematical Physics 2006, Volume 149, Issue 1, pp 1324-1337

entry.title: Integrable inhomogeneous Lakshmanan-Myrzakulov equation
entry.summary: The integrable inhomogeneous extension of the Lakshmanan-Myrzakulov equation is constructed by using the prolongation structure theory. The corresponding L-equivalent counterpart is also given, which is the (2+1)-dimensional generalized NLSE.

entry.title: Differential invariants of generic hyperbolic Monge--Ampère equations
entry.summary: In this paper basic differential invariants of generic hyperbolic Monge--Amp\`ere equations with respect to contact transformations are constructed and the equivalence problem for these equations is solved.

entry.title: Transformations of integrable hydrodynamic chains and their hydrodynamic reductions
entry.summary: Hydrodynamic reductions of the hydrodynamic chain associated with dispersionless limit of 2+1 Harry Dym equation are found by the Miura type and reciprocal transformations applied to the Benney hydrodynamic chain.

entry.title: Recursion operator for the IGSG equation
entry.summary: In this paper we find the inverse and direct recursion operator for the intrinsic generalized sine-Gordon equation in any number $n > 2$ of independent variables. Among the flows generated by the direct operator we identify a higher-dimensional analogue of the pmKdV equation.

entry.title: Corrugated surfaces with slow modulation and quasiclassical Weierstrass representation
entry.summary: Quasiclassical generalized Weierstrass representation for highly corrugated surfaces with slow modulation in the three-dimensional space is proposed. Integrable deformations of such surfaces are described by the dispersionless Veselov-Novikov hierarchy.

entry.title: Integrability of the Egorov hydrodynamic type systems
entry.summary: Integrability criterion for the Egorov hydrodynamic type systems is presented. The general solution by generalized hodograph method is found. Examples are given

entry.title: Macroscopic parameters of Fokker-Planck flows
entry.summary: The aim of this work is to investigate properties of solutions of Fokker - Planck equation in the context of continuum mechanics. We show that average quantities, calculated for these solutions approximately satisfy equations of isothermal motion of viscous ideal gas.

entry.title: On a class of third order mappings with two rational invariants
entry.summary: A novel family of integrable third order maps is presented. Each map possesses, by construction, a pair of rational invariants and a commuting map from the same class. The 3-dimensional invariant curve is parametrized, in general, by an elliptic curve.

entry.title: A note on the superintegrability of the Toda lattice
entry.summary: The superintegrability of the non-periodic Toda lattice is explained in the framework of systems written in action-angles coordinates. Moreover, a simpler form of the first integrals is given.

entry.title: Bianchi surfaces. Integrability in arbitrary parametrization
entry.summary: We discuss integrability of normal field equations of arbitrary parametrised Bianchi surfaces. A novel geometric definition of Bianchi surfaces is presented as well as B\"acklund transformation for the normal field equations in arbitrary chosen surface parametrization.

entry.title: Local Conservation Laws and the Hamiltonian Formalism for the Toda Hierarchy Revisited
entry.summary: We revisit an elementary recursive approach to local conservation laws and the Hamiltonian formalism for the Toda hierarchy.

entry.title: On the initial value problem of a periodic box-ball system
entry.summary: We show that the initial value problem of a periodic box-ball system can be solved in an elementary way using simple combinatorial methods.

entry.title: Hydrodynamical vortex on the plane
entry.summary: The detailed analysis of model of the hydrodynamical vortice on a plane is executed. The derivation of the corresponding equation and its simplified variant is given, a partial solutions are constructed. The question on application of Darboux transformation is considered.

entry.title: A symmetry test for quasilinear coupled systems
entry.summary: All quasilinear NLS-type systems with fourth order symmetry are listed. Vector generalizations of some of them are constructed. Local master symmetries for several systems from the list are found.

entry.title: On the two different bi-Hamiltonian structures for the Toda lattice
entry.summary: We construct two different incompatible Poisson pencils for the Toda lattice by using known variables of separation proposed by Moser and by Sklyanin.

entry.title: Spiral Wave Solutions of One-dimensional Ginzburg-Landau Equation By Extended F-expansion Method
entry.summary: The one-dimensional Ginzburg-Landau (GL) Equation is considered. We use the recently developed extended F-expansion method to obtain spiral wave solution of one-dimensional GL Equation.

entry.title: Generalized Differential Galois Theory
entry.summary: A Galois theory of differential fields with parameters is developed in a manner that generalizes Kolchin's theory. It is shown that all connected differential algebraic groups are Galois groups of some appropriate differential field extension.
entry.arxiv:comment: 71 pages, part of author's Phd. thesis

entry.title: Nonisospectral integrable nonlinear equations with external potentials and their GBDT solutions
entry.summary: Auxiliary systems for matrix nonisospectral equations, including coupled NLS with external potential and KdV with variable coefficients, were introduced. Explicit solutions of nonisospectral equations were constructed using the GBDT version of the B\"acklund-Darboux transformation.

entry.title: On solutions of Rashevskii equation
entry.summary: The solutions of Rashevskii equation for gonometric family of plane curves are considered. Their properties are studied. The connection with the theory of duality for the second order ODE's is discussed.

entry.title: Symbolic representation and classification of integrable systems
entry.summary: This is a review paper of recent results in the perturbative symmetry approach in the symbolic representation.

entry.title: Bilinearization and Casorati determinant solution to the non-autonomous discrete KdV equation
entry.summary: Casorati determinant solution to the non-autonomous discrete KdV equation is constructed by using the bilinear formalism. We present three different bilinear formulations which have different origins.

entry.title: Global action-angle variables for the periodic Toda lattice
entry.summary: In this paper we construct global action-angle variables for the periodic Toda lattice.

entry.title: Global Birkhoff coordinates for the periodic Toda lattice
entry.summary: In this paper we prove that the periodic Toda lattice admits globally defined Birkhoff coordinates.

entry.title: Cartan's structure of symmetry pseudo-group and coverings for the r-th modified dispersionless Kadomtsev--Petviashvili equation
entry.summary: We derive two non-equivalent coverings for the r-th mdKP equation from Maurer--Cartan forms of its symmetry pseudo-group. Also we find B\"acklund transformations between the covering equations.

entry.title: An application of the Casoratian technique to the 2D Toda lattice equation
entry.summary: A general Casoratian formulation is proposed for the 2D Toda lattice equation, which involves coupled eigenfunction systems. Various Casoratian type solutions are generated, through solving the resulting linear conditions and using a Baecklund transformation.

entry.title: A New Expression of Soliton Solution to the Ultradiscrete Toda Equation
entry.summary: A new type of multi-soliton solution to the ultradiscrete Toda equation is proposed. The solution can be transformed into another expression of solution in a perturbation form. A direct proof of the solution is also given.

entry.title: Reductions of integrable lattices
entry.summary: Based on the notion of Darboux-KP chain hierarchy and its invariant submanifolds we construct some class of constraints compatible with integrable lattices. Some simple examples are given.

entry.title: On Geometry of the Rössler system of equations
entry.summary: On a basis of theory of Riemann extension of the space of constant affine connection associated with the R\"ossler system of equations relations between its parameters are investigated.

entry.title: Geometry of quadrilateral nets: second Hamiltonian form
entry.summary: Discrete Darboux-Manakov-Zakharov systems possess two distinct Hamiltonian forms. In the framework of discrete-differential geometry one Hamiltonian form appears in a geometry of circular net. In this paper a geometry of second form is identified.

entry.title: Random matrices with external source and KP $τ$ functions
entry.summary: In this paper we prove that the partition function in the random matrix model with external source is a KP $\tau$ function.

entry.title: Eight-dimensional Ricci-flat space related with the KP equation
entry.summary: Eight-dimensional the Ricci-flat space defined by solutions of the Kadomtsev-Petviashvili equatin is presented. Its properties are discussed

entry.title: On $τ$-function of the quadrilateral lattice
entry.summary: We investigate the $\tau$-function of the quadrilateral lattice using the nonlocal $\bar\partial$-dressing method, and we show that it can be identified with the Fredholm determinant of the integral equation which naturally appears within that approach.

entry.title: Bifurcations of Liouville Tori in Elliptical Billiards
entry.summary: A detailed description of topology of integrable billiard systems is given. For elliptical billiards and geodesic billiards on ellipsoid, the corresponding Fomenko graphs are constructed.

entry.title: On Non-Commutative Integrable Burgers Equations
entry.summary: We construct the recursion operators for the non-commutative Burgers equations using their Lax operators. We investigate the existence of any integrable mixed version of left- and right-handed Burgers equations on higher symmetry grounds.

entry.title: The Kundu--Eckhaus equation and its discretizations
entry.summary: In this article we show that the complex Burgers and the Kundu--Eckhaus equations are related by a Miura transformation. We use this relation to discretize the Kundu--Eckhaus equation.

entry.title: Incoherent bound states in an infinite $XXZ$ chain at $Δ=-1/2$
entry.summary: For an infinite $XXZ$ chain with $\Delta=-1/2$ we have obtained a family of translationary invariant three-magnon states which do not satisfy the string conjecture. All of them have the same energy.

entry.title: Inverse Scattering Transform and the Theory of Solitons
entry.summary: A review of the inverse scattering transform is given, and an introduction to solitons is provided.
entry.arxiv:comment: review article to appear in Encyclopedia of Complexity and Systems Science
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Encyclopedia of Complexity and Systems Science, R. A. Meyers (ed.), Springer, New York, 2009, pp. 4960-4971.

entry.title: The tangential map and associated integrable equations
entry.summary: The tangential map is a map on the set of smooth planar curves. It satisfies the 3D-consistency property and is closely related to some well-known integrable equations.

entry.title: Algebraic constraints on Tau functions of P reduced KP with String equation
entry.summary: Give a convenient new approach to obtain the algebraic constraints on tau functions of p-reduced KP with the constraints of string equation. The classical results about algebraic constraints on associated tau function are included.

entry.title: Vertex operator for the non-autonomous ultradiscrete KP equation
entry.summary: We propose an ultradiscrete analogue of the vertex operator in the case of the ultradiscrete KP equation--several other ultradiscrete equations--which maps N-soliton solutions to N+1-soliton ones.

entry.title: Integrable hyperbolic equations of sin-Gordon type
entry.summary: A complete list of nonlinear one-field hyperbolic equations having generalized integrable x- and y-symmetries of the third order is presented. The list includes both sin-Gordon type equations and equations linearizable by differential substitutions.

entry.title: Classification of integrable hydrodynamic chains
entry.summary: Using the method of hydrodynamic reductions, we find all integrable infinite (1+1)-dimensional hydrodynamic-type chains of shift one. A class of integrable infinite (2+1)-dimensional hydrodynamic-type chains is constructed.

entry.title: Bihamiltonian Structure of the Two-component Kadomtsev-Petviashvili Hierarchy of type B
entry.summary: We employ a Lax pair representation of the two-component BKP hierarchy and construct its bihamiltonian structure with R-matrix techniques.

entry.title: New explicit exact solutions for the Liénard equation and its applications
entry.summary: In this letter, new exact explicit solutions are obtained for the Li\'enard equation, and the applications of the results to the generalized Pochhammer-Chree equation, the Kundu equation and the generalized long-short wave resonance equations are presented.

entry.title: On the bi-Hamiltonian structure of Bogoyavlensky system on $so(4)$
entry.summary: We discuss bi-Hamiltonian structure for the Bogoyavlensky system on $so(4)$ with an additional integral of fourth order in momenta. An explicit procedure to find the variables of separation and the separation relations is considered in detail.

entry.title: Reciprocal link among the Qiao-Liu peakon equation and the modified Korteweg-de Vries equation
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author. The result is already known.

entry.title: On rational solutions of multicomponent and matrix KP hierarchies
entry.summary: We derive some rational solutions for the multicomponent and matrix KP hierarchies generalising an approach by Wilson. Connections with the multicomponent version of the KP/CM correspondence are discussed.

entry.title: N-soliton solutions of an integrable equation studied by Qiao
entry.summary: In this paper, we studied N-soliton solutions of an integrable equation.

entry.title: Discretization of hyperbolic type Darboux integrable equations preserving integrability
entry.summary: A method of integrable discretization of the Liouville type nonlinear partial differential equations is suggested based on integrals. New examples of discrete Liouville type models are presented.

entry.title: A remark on Dickey's stabilizing chain
entry.summary: We observe that Dickey's stabilizing chain can be naturally included into two-dimensional chain of infinitely many copies of equations of KP hierarchy.

entry.title: Computable Integrability
entry.summary: This is a preliminary version of the textbook on integrable systems. The work has been partly supported by Grant Nr.10/2006-RU, Austrian Academic Exchange Service \"OAD and Grant P20164-N18, Austrian Science Fund FWF

entry.title: Laplace Invariants for General Hyperbolic Systems
entry.summary: We consider the generalization of Laplace invariants to linear differential systems of arbitrary rank and dimension. We discuss completeness of certain subsets of invariants.

entry.title: Recursion operator of the Narita-Itoh-Bogoyavlensky lattice
entry.summary: We construct a recursion operator for the family of Narita-Itoh-Bogoyavlensky infinite lattice equations using its Lax presentation and present their mastersymmetries and bi-Hamiltonian structures. We show that this highly nonlocal recursion operator generates infinite many local symmetries.

entry.title: A bi-Hamiltonian Integrable Two Component Generalization of the third-Order Burgers Equation
entry.summary: We announce a new bi-Hamiltonian integrable two-component system admitting the scalar 3rd-order Burgers equation as a reduction.

entry.title: The integral type gauge transformation and the additional symmetry for the constrained KP hierarchy
entry.summary: In this paper, the compatibility between the integral type gauge transformation and the additional symmetry of the constrained KP hierarchy is given. And the string-equation constraint in matrix models is also derived.

entry.title: Quasi-Grammian Solutions of the Generalized Coupled Dispersionless Integrable System
entry.summary: The standard binary Darboux transformation is investigated and is used to obtain quasi-Grammian multisoliton solutions of the generalized coupled dispersionless integrable system.

entry.title: On generalized nonholonomic Chaplygin sphere problem
entry.summary: We discuss linear in momenta Poisson structure for the generalized nonholonomic Chaplygin sphere problem and prove that it is non-trivial deformation of the canonical Poisson structure on e^*(3).

entry.title: A systemic method to construct the high order nonlocal symmetries
entry.summary: We propose a systemic method of applying the auxiliary systems of original equations to find the high order nonlocal symmetries of nonlinear evolution equation. In order to validate the effectiveness of the method, some examples are presented.

entry.title: On some class of differential-difference equations admitting Lax representation
entry.summary: This note is designed to show some classes of differential-difference equations admitting Lax representation which generalize evolutionary equations known in the literature.

entry.title: On the classification of fifth-order integrable systems
entry.summary: In this work we classify the fifth-order integrable symmetrically coup led systems of weight 0 that possess seventh-order symmetry. we obtained 2 new integrable systems that related bi-Hamiltonian formulations are constructed too.

entry.title: Characteristics of conservations laws of chiral-type systems
entry.summary: In this note a new way to construct the characteristics of conservations laws of integrable chiral-type systems is proposed.

entry.title: The Constant Astigmatism Equation. New Exact Solution
entry.summary: In this paper we present a new solution for the Constant Astigmatism equation. This solution is parameterized by an arbitrary function of a single variable.

entry.title: Complete Integrability Of The Fifth-Order Mikhailov-Novikov-Wang system
entry.summary: The symplectic-Hamiltonian formulation and recursion operator of the fifth-order Mikhailov-Novikov-Wang system are given.

entry.title: Flat coordinates for flat Stäckel systems
entry.summary: In this article we explicitely construct transformation bewteen separable and flat coordinates for flat St\"ackel systems and exploit the structre of these systems in flat coordinates. In the elliptic case these coordinates become well known generalized elliptical coordinates of Jacobi.

entry.title: Algebro-geometric solution of the coupled Burgers equation
entry.summary: We derive theta function representation of algebro-geometric solution of a Coupled Burgers equation which the second nonlinear evolution equation in a hierarchy. We also derive the algebro-geometric characters of the meromorphic function {\phi} and the Baker-Akhiezer vector {\Psi}.

entry.title: On the peakon inverse problem for the Degasperis-Procesi equation
entry.summary: The peakon inverse problem for the Degasperis-Procesi equation is solved directly on the real line, using Cauchy biorthogonal polynomials, without any additional transformation to a "string" type boundary value problem known from prior works.

entry.title: Algebraic entropy for differential-delay equations
entry.summary: We extend the definition of algebraic entropy to a class of differential-delay equations. The vanishing of the entropy, as a structural property of an equation, signals its integrability. We suggest a simple way to produce differential-delay equations with vanishing entropy from known integrable differential-difference equations.

entry.title: On Darboux integrability of discrete 2D Toda lattices
entry.summary: Darboux integrability of semidiscrete and discrete 2D Toda lattices corresponding to Lie algebras of A and C series is proved.

entry.title: Absence of solitons for the defocusing NLS equation on the half-line
entry.summary: It has been conjectured that the defocusing nonlinear Schr\"odinger (NLS) equation on the half-line does not admit solitons. We give a proof of this conjecture.

entry.title: On the combinatorics of several integrable hierarchies
entry.summary: We demonstrate that statistics of certain classes of set partitions is described by generating functions related to the Burgers, Ibragimov--Shabat and Korteweg--de Vries integrable hierarchies.

entry.title: A Bäcklund transformation between 4D Martínez Alonso -- Shabat and Ferapontov -- Khusnutdinova equations
entry.summary: We find a B\"acklund transformation between 4-dimensional Mart\'{\i}nez Alonso -- Shabat and Ferapontov -- Khusnutdinova equations.

entry.title: The improved (G'/G)- expansion method is equivalent to the tanh method
entry.summary: In this paper, we show that the improved (G'/G)- expansion method is equivalent to the tanh method and gives the same exact solutions of nonlinear partial differential equations.

entry.title: Set partitions and integrable hierarchies
entry.summary: We demonstrate that statistics for several types of set partitions are described by generating functions which appear in the theory of integrable equations.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Theoretical and Mathematical Physics 2016, Volume 187, Issue 3, pp 842-870

entry.title: A five-dimensional solitary-wave first order nonlinear PDE integrable by dressing method
entry.summary: We derive a five-dimensional nonlinear first order matrix PDE which is a generalization of the completely integrable (2+1)-dimensional $N$-wave equation. Similar to the $\bar\partial$-problem, our algorithm is based on the linear integral equation of special form.

entry.title: Billiards in confocal quadrics as a pluri-Lagrangian system
entry.summary: We illustrate the theory of one-dimensional pluri-Lagrangian systems with the example of commuting billiard maps in confocal quadrics.

entry.title: A note on some superintegrable Hamiltonian systems
entry.summary: We consider some examples of superintegrable system which were recently isolated through a differential Galois group analysis. The identity of these systems is clarified and the corresponding Poisson algebras derived.

entry.title: Nonlocal conservation laws of the constant astigmatism equation
entry.summary: For the constant astigmatism equation, we construct a system of nonlocal conservation laws (an abelian covering) closed under the reciprocal transformations. We give functionally independent potentials modulo a Wronskian type relation.

entry.title: Semi-discrete hyperbolic equations admitting five dimensional characteristic $x$-ring
entry.summary: The necessary and sufficient conditions for a hyperbolic semi-discrete equation to have five dimensional characteristic {\it x}-ring are derived. For any given chain, the derived conditions are easily verifiable by straightforward calculations.

entry.title: A generalized super integrable hierarchy of Dirac type
entry.summary: In this letter, a new generalized matrix spectral problem of Dirac type associated with the super Lie algebra $\mathcal{B}(0,1)$ is proposed and its corresponding super integrable hierarchy is constructed.

entry.title: Painlevé analysis for two 1D parabolic-parabolic models of chemotaxis; some travelling wave solutions
entry.summary: In this paper we study the Painlev\'e analysis for two models of chemotaxis. We find that in some cases the reductions of these models in terms of travelling wave variable allow exact analytical solutions.

entry.title: Bilinear gauge operators
entry.summary: We construct a family of bilinear differential operators which satisfy certain gauge properties. These operators can be naturally associated with $q$-deformations of classical integrable hierarchies. In particular, we consider the case when gauge function $=$ Hurwitz-type partition function.

entry.title: Symmetry, reductions and exact solutions of the difference equation $u_{n+2}=au_n/(1+bu_nu_{n+1})$
entry.summary: We investigate the solutions of the second-order difference equation $u_{n+2}=(au_n)/(1+bu_nu_{n+1})$ using a group of transformations (Lie symmetries) that leaves the solutions invariant.

entry.title: Derivation of Higher Dimensional Periodic Recurrence Equations by Nested Structure of Complex Numbers
entry.summary: In this paper, we give a procedure for derivation of higher dimensional periodic recurrence equations(PREs) by nested structure of complex numbers.

entry.title: On classification of higher-order integrable nonlinear partial differential equations
entry.summary: We investigate existence of solitonic solutions for higher-order partial differential equations with polynomial nonlinearities. Using the Hirota method we obtain classification for higher-order integrable systems of equations.

entry.title: Generalizations of the short pulse equation
entry.summary: We classify integrable scalar polynomial partial differential equations of second order generalizing the short pulse equation.

entry.title: The solution to the initial value problem for the ultradiscrete Somos-4 and 5 equations
entry.summary: We propose a method to solve the initial value problem for the ultradiscrete Somos-4 and Somos-5 equations by expressing terms in the equations as convex polygons and regarding max-plus algebras as those on polygons.

entry.title: On a new avatar of the sine-Gordon equation
entry.summary: A chain of transformations is found which relates one new integrable case of the generalized short pulse equation of Hone, Novikov and Wang [arXiv:1612.02481] with the sine-Gordon equation.

entry.title: Nonlocal Super Integrable Equations
entry.summary: We present nonlocal integrable reductions of super AKNS coupled equations. By the use of nonlocal reductions of Ablowitz and Musslimani we find new super integrable equations. In particular we introduce nonlocal super NLS equations and the nonlocal super mKdV equations.

entry.title: Weakly integrable Camassa-Holm-type equations
entry.summary: Series of deformed Camassa-Holm-type equations are constructed using the Lagrangian deformation and Loop algebra splittings. They are weakly integrable in the sense of modified Lax pairs.
entry.arxiv:comment: Accepted by Romanian Journal of Physics(Dec., 2016)

entry.title: Exact traveling wave solutions of 1D parabolic-parabolic models of chemotaxis
entry.summary: In this paper we consider three different 1D parabolic-parabolic systems of chemotaxis. For these systems we obtain the exact analytical solutions in terms of traveling wave variables.

entry.title: Alice-Bob Peakon Systems
entry.summary: In this letter, we study the Alice-Bob peakon system generated from an integrable peakon system through using the strategy of the so-called Alice-Bob non-local KdV approach [13]. Non-local integrable peakon equations are obtained and shown to have peakon solutions.

entry.title: Super Extensions of the Short Pulse Equation
entry.summary: From a super extension of the Wadati, Konno and Ichikawa scheme for integrable systems and using a $\mathrm{osp(1,2)}$ valued connection 1-form we obtain super generalizations for the Short Pulse equation as well for the Elastic Beam equation.

entry.title: A formula with hypervolumes of six 4-simplices and two discrete curvatures
entry.summary: One of the generalizations of the pentagon equation to higher dimensions is the so-called "six-term equation". Geometrically, it corresponds to one of the "Alexander moves", that is elementary rebuildings of simplicial complexes, namely, replacing a "cluster" of three 4-simplices by another "cluster", also of three 4-simplices and with the same boundary. We present a formula containing the euclidean volumes of the simplices in the first cluster in its l.h.s., and those in the second cluster - in its r.h.s. The formula also involves "discrete curvatures" appearing when we slightly deform the euclidean space.
entry.arxiv:comment: LaTeX, 3 pages, continues solv-int/9911008 and nlin.SI/0003001

entry.title: The affine $A_{n-1}^{(1)}$ Toda fields with boundary reflection
entry.summary: We study the affine $A_{n-1}^{(1)}$ Toda fields with boundary reflection. Our approach is based on the free field approach. We construct free field realizations of the boundary state and its dual. For an application of these realizations, we present integral representations for the form factors of the local operators. In a limiting case $\rho \to \infty$, our integral representations reproduce those of form factors for the SU(n) invariant massive Thirring model with boundary reflection [nlin.SI/0010020,Int.J.Mod.Phys.A16,no.15 (2001)2665-2689].

entry.title: Baxter Q-operators for integrable DST chain
entry.summary: Following the procedure, described in the paper nlin.SI/0003002, for the integrable DST chain we construct Baxter Q-operators as the traces of monodromy of some M-operators, that act in quantum and auxiliary spaces. Within this procedure we obtain two basic M-operators and derive some functional relations between them such as intertwining relations and wronskian-type relations between two basic Q-operators.
entry.arxiv:comment: LaTeX, 12 pages, minor changes in the text, references added

entry.title: Radial Loewner equation and dispersionless cmKP hierarchy
entry.summary: It has been shown that the dispersionless KP hierarchy (or the Benney hierarchy) is reduced to the chordal L\"owner equation. We show that the radial L\"owner equation also gives reduction of a dispersionless type integrable system. The resulting system acquires another degree of freedom and becomes the dcmKP hierarchy, which is a ``half'' of the dispersionless Toda hierarchy. The results of this article was announced in nlin.SI/0512008.

entry.title: Inverse Scattering Problem for Vector Fields and the Cauchy Problem for the Heavenly Equation
entry.summary: We solve the inverse scattering problem for multidimensional vector fields and we use this result to construct the formal solution of the Cauchy problem for the second heavenly equation of Plebanski, a scalar nonlinear partial differential equation in four dimensions relevant in General Relativity, which arises from the commutation of multidimensional Hamiltonian vector fields.
entry.arxiv:comment: 15 pages, submitted to Phisics Letters A. This paper replaces nlin.SI/0512043

entry.title: Differential Geometry of Hydrodynamic Vlasov Equations
entry.summary: We consider hydrodynamic chains in $(1+1)$ dimensions which are Hamiltonian with respect to the Kupershmidt-Manin Poisson bracket. These systems can be derived from single $(2+1)$ equations, here called hydrodynamic Vlasov equations, under the map $A^n =\int_{-\infty}^\infty p^n f dp.$ For these equations an analogue of the Dubrovin-Novikov Hamiltonian structure is constructed. The Vlasov formalism allows us to describe objects like the Haantjes tensor for such a chain in a much more compact and computable way. We prove that the necessary conditions found by Ferapontov and Marshall in (arXiv:nlin.SI/0505013) for the integrability of these hydrodynamic chains are also sufficient.

entry.title: Generalized N=4 supersymmetric Toda lattice hierarchy and N=4 superintegrable mapping
entry.summary: It is shown that the one-dimensional generalized N=4 supersymmetric Toda lattice (TL) hierarchy (nlin.Si/0311030) contains the N=4 super-KdV hierarchy with the first flow time in the role of space coordinate. Two different N=2 superfield forms of the generalized N=4 supersymmetric TL equation, which are useful when solving the N=4 super-KdV and (1,1)-GNLS hierarchies, are discussed.

entry.title: Soliton Solutions for ABS Lattice Equations II: Casoratians and Bilinearization
entry.summary: In Part I [arXiv:0902.4873 [nlin.SI]] soliton solutions to the ABS list of multi-dimensionally consistent difference equations (except Q4) were derived using connection between the Q3 equation and the NQC equations, and then by reductions. In that work central role was played by a Cauchy matrix. In this work we use a different approach, we derive the $N$-soliton solutions following Hirota's direct and constructive method. This leads to Casoratians and bilinear difference equations. We give here details for the H-series of equations and for Q1; the results for Q3 have been given earlier.

entry.title: Lagrangian multiform structure for the lattice Gel'fand-Dikii hierarchy
entry.summary: The lattice Gel'fand-Dikii hierarchy was introduced by Nijhoff, Papageorgiou, Capel and Quispel in 1992 as the family of partial difference equations generalizing to higher rank the lattice Korteweg-de Vries systems, and includes in particular the lattice Boussinesq system. We present a Lagrangian for the generic member of the lattice Gel'fand-Dikii hierarchy, and show that it can be considered as a Lagrangian 2-form when embedded in a higher dimensional lattice, obeying a closure relation. Thus the multiform structure proposed in arXiv:0903.4086v2 [nlin.SI] is extended to a multi-component system.

entry.title: Neumann and Bargmann systems associated with an extension of the coupled KdV hierarchy
entry.summary: An eigenvalue problem with a reference function and the corresponding hierarchy of nonlinear evolution equations are proposed. The bi-Hamiltonian structure of the hierarchy is established by using the trace identity. The isospectral problem is nonlinearized as to be finite-dimensional completely integrable systems in Liouville sense under Neumann and Bargmann constraints.

entry.title: The Supercomplexifications And Odd Bihamiltonians Structures
entry.summary: The general method of the cojmplex supersymmetrization (supercomplexifications) of the soliton equations with the odd (bi) hamiltoninan structure is established. New version of the supercomplexified Kadomtsev-Petvishvili hierarchy is given. The second odd Hamiltonina operator of the SUSY KdV equation generates the odd N=2 SUSY Virasoro like algebra.

author.name: Ziemowit Popowicz
author.arxiv:affiliation: Institute of Theoretical Physics University of Wrocław Poland

entry.arxiv:comment: Proceeding of the International Seminar "Supersymmetry and Quantum Symmetries (July 1999 Dubna Rosia)

entry.title: Bihamiltonian geometry and separation of variables for Toda lattices
entry.summary: We discuss the bihamiltonian geometry of the Toda lattice (periodic and open). Using some recent results on the separation of variables for bihamiltonian manifolds, we show that these systems can be explicitly integrated via the classical Hamilton-Jacobi method in the so-called Darboux-Nijenhuis coordinates.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages, Latex with amsmath and amssymb. Report of talks given at NEEDS99

entry.title: Coupled higher-order nonlinear Schroedinger equations: a new integrable case via the singularity analysis
entry.summary: A new system of coupled higher-order nonlinear Schroedinger equations is proposed which passes the Painleve test for integrability well. A Lax pair and a multi-field generalization are obtained for the new system.

entry.title: Dispersionless sTB
entry.summary: We analyze the dispersionless limits of the SUSY TB-B (sTB-B) and the SUSY TB (sTB) hierarchies. We present the Lax description for each of these models, as well as the N=2 sTB hierarchy and bring out various properties associated with them. We also discuss open questions that need to be addressed in connection with these models.

entry.title: On Baxter Q-operators for Toda Chain
entry.summary: We suggest the procedure of the construction of Baxter Q-operators for Toda chain . Apart from the one-paramitric family of Q-operators, considered in our recent paper (hep-th/9908179) we also give the construction of two basic Q-operators and the derivation of the functional relations for these operators. Also we have found the relation of the basic Q-operators with Bloch solutions of the quantum linear problem.

entry.title: Heisenberg spin chains based on sl(2|1) symmetry
entry.summary: We find solutions of the Yang-Baxter equation acting on tensor product of arbitrary representations of the superalgebra sl(2|1). Based on these solutions we construct the local Hamiltonians for integrable homogeneous periodic chains and open chains.

entry.title: Degenerate Poisson pencils on curves: new separability theory
entry.summary: A review of a new separability theory based on degenerated Poisson pencils and the so-called separation curves is presented. This theory can be considered as an alternative to the Sklyanin theory based on Lax representations and the so-called spectral curves.

entry.title: The classical massive Thirring system revisited
entry.summary: We provide a complete treatment of algebro-geometric solutions of the classical massive Thirring system. In particular, we study Dubrovin-type equations for auxiliary divisors, consider the corresponding algebro-geometric initial value problem, and derive the theta function representations of algebro-geometric solutions of the Thirring system.

entry.title: The critical $A_{n-1}^{(1)}$ chain
entry.summary: We study the $A_{n-1}^{(1)}$ spin chain at the critical regime $|q|=1$. We give the free boson realizations of the type-I vertex operators and their duals. Using these free boson realizations, we give the integral representations for the correlation functions.

entry.title: On some nondecaying potentials and related Jost solutions for the heat conduction equation
entry.summary: Potentials of the heat conduction operator constructed by means of 2 binary Backlund transformations are studied in detail. Corresponding Darboux transformations of the Jost solutions are introduced. We show that these solutions obey modified integral equations and present their analyticity properties.
entry.arxiv:comment: LaTex, 17 pages, no figures, to appear on Inverse Problems

entry.title: Point Symmetries of Generalized Toda Field Theories
entry.summary: A class of two-dimensional field theories with exponential interactions is introduced. The interaction depends on two ``coupling'' matrices and is sufficiently general to include all Toda field theories existing in the literature. Lie point symmetries of these theories are found for an infinite, semi-infinite and finite number of fields. Special attention is accorded to conformal invariance and its breaking.

entry.title: Point Symmetries of Generalized Toda Field Theories II Applications of the Symmetries
entry.summary: The Lie symmetries of a large class of generalized Toda field theories are studied and used to perform symmetry reduction. Reductions lead to generalized Toda lattices on one hand, to periodic systems on the other. Boundary conditions are introduced to reduce theories on an infinite lattice to those on semi-infinite, or finite ones.

entry.title: A new integrable system of symmetrically coupled derivative nonlinear Schroedinger equations via the singularity analysis
entry.summary: A new integrable system of two symmetrically coupled derivative nonlinear Schroedinger equations is detected by means of the singularity analysis. A nonlinear transformation is proposed which uncouples the equations of the new system.

entry.title: First integrals generated by pseudosymmetries in Nambu-Poisson mechanics
entry.summary: Some types of first integrals for Hamiltonian Nambu-Poisson vector fields are obtained by using the notions of pseudosymmetries. In this theory, the homogeneous Hamiltonian vector fields play a special role and we point out this fact. The differential system which describe the $SU(2)$-monopoles is given as example. The paper ends with two appendices.

entry.title: The 19-Vertex Model at critical regime $|q|=1$
entry.summary: We study the 19-vertex model associated with the quantum group $U_q(\hat{sl_2})$ at critical regime $|q|=1$. We give the realizations of the type-I vertex operators in terms of free bosons and free fermions. Using these free field realizations, we give the integral representations for the correlation functions.

entry.title: The Drinfel'd twisted XYZ model
entry.summary: We construct a factorizing Drinfel'd twist for a face type model equivalent to the XYZ model. Completely symmetric expressions for the operators of the monodromy matrix are obtained.
entry.arxiv:comment: 15 pages, 4 figures, second preprint no. added, reference [14] added, typos corrected

entry.title: On the behaviour of solutions to discrete time Lotka-Volterra equation
entry.summary: The time evolution of a class of completely integrable discrete Lotka-Volterra s ystem is shown not unique but have two different ways chosen randomly at every s tep of generation. This uncertainty is consistent with the existence of constant s of motion and disappears in both continuous time and ultra discrete limits.

entry.title: Principal models on a solvable group with nonconstant metric
entry.summary: Field equations for generalized principle models with nonconstant metric are derived and ansatz for their Lax pairs is given. Equations that define the Lax pairs are solved for the simplest solvable group. The solution is dependent on one free variable that can serve as the spectral parameter. Painleve analysis of the resulting model is performed and its particular solutions are found

entry.title: The massless XXZ chain with a boundary
entry.summary: We study the XXZ chain with a boundary at massless regime $-1<\Delta<1$. We give the free field realizations of the boundary vacuum state and it's dual. Using these realizations, we give the integrable representations of the correlation functions.

entry.title: Bicomplexes and Integrable Models
entry.summary: We associate bicomplexes with several integrable models in such a way that conserved currents are obtained by a simple iterative construction. Gauge transformations and dressings are discussed in this framework and several examples are presented, including the nonlinear Schrodinger and sine-Gordon equations, and some discrete models.
entry.arxiv:comment: 17 pages, LaTeX, uses amssymb.sty and diagrams.sty

entry.title: Poisson brackets on rational functions and multi-Hamiltonian structure for integrable lattices
entry.summary: We introduce a family of compatible Poisson brackets on the space of rational functions with denominator of a fixed degree and use it to derive a multi-Hamiltonian structure for a family of integrable lattice equations that includes both the standard and the relativistic Toda lattices.

entry.title: Hidden N=(2|2) supersymmetry of the N=(1|1) supersymmetric Toda lattice hierarchy
entry.summary: An N=(2|2) superfield formulation of the N=(1|1) supersymmetric Toda lattice hierarchy is proposed, and its five real forms are presented.

entry.title: Rational Solutions of the Painleve' VI Equation
entry.summary: In this paper, we classify all values of the parameters $\alpha$, $\beta$, $\gamma$ and $\delta$ of the Painlev\'e VI equation such that there are rational solutions. We give a formula for them up to the birational canonical transformations and the symmetries of the Painlev\'e VI equation.

entry.title: Recursion Operators of Some Equations of Hydrodynamic Type
entry.summary: We give a general method for constructing recursion operators for some equations of hydrodynamic type, admitting a nonstandard Lax representation. We give several examples for N=2 and N=3 containing the equations of shallow water waves and its generalizations with their first two higher symmetries and their recursion operators. We also discuss a reduction of $N+1$ systems to $N$ systems of some new equations of hydrodynamic type.

entry.title: Backlund transformations for the sl(2) Gaudin magnet
entry.summary: Elementary, one- and two-point, Backlund transformations are constructed for the generic case of the sl(2) Gaudin magnet. The spectrality property is used to construct these explicitly given, Poisson integrable maps which are time-discretizations of the continuous flows with any Hamiltonian from the spectral curve of the 2x2 Lax matrix.

entry.title: Finite XXZ critical chain with double boundaries
entry.summary: Finite XXZ chain with double boundaries is considered at critical regime $-1<\Delta<1$. We construct the eigenvectors of finite Hamiltonian by means of vertex operators and the quasi-boundary states. Using the free field realizations of the vertex operators and the quasi-boundary states, integral representations for the correlation functions are derived.

entry.title: Supersymmetric integrable systems from geodesic flows on superconformal groups
entry.summary: We discuss the possible relationship between geodesic flow, integrability and supersymmetry, using fermionic extensions of the KdV equation, as well as the recently introduced supersymmetrisation of the Camassa-Holm equation, as illustrative examples.

entry.title: Multisoliton solutions and integrability aspects of coupled nonlinear Schrodinger equations
entry.summary: Using Painleve singularity structure analysis, we show that coupled higher-order nonlinear Schrodinger (CHNLS) equations admit Painleve property. Using the results of Painleve analysis, we succeed in Hirota bilinearizing the CHNLS equations, one soliton and two soliton solutions are explictly obtained. Lax pairs are explictly constructed.
entry.arxiv:comment: Eight pages and six figures. Physical Review E (to be appear)

entry.title: The spin 1/2 Calogero-Gaudin System and its q-Deformation
entry.summary: The spin 1/2 Calogero-Gaudin system and its q-deformation are exactly solved: a complete set of commuting observables is diagonalized, and the corresponding eigenvectors and eigenvalues are explicitly calculated. The method of solution is purely algebraic and relies on the co-algebra simmetry of the model.

entry.title: Reductions and real forms of Hamiltonian systems related to N-wave type equations
entry.summary: Reductions of N-wave type equations related to simple Lie algebras and the hierarchy of their Hamiltonian structures are studied. The reduction group G_R is realized as a subgroup of the Weyl group of the corresponding algebra. Some of the reduced equations are of physical interest.

author.name: V. S. Gerdjikov
author.arxiv:affiliation: Institute for Nuclear Research and Nuclear Energy, Sofia, Bulgaria

author.name: G. G. Grahovski
author.arxiv:affiliation: Institute for Nuclear Research and Nuclear Energy, Sofia, Bulgaria

entry.title: Dynamical models of adiabatic $N $-soliton interactions
entry.summary: The adiabatic N-soliton train interactions for the scalar nonlinear Schrodinger (NLS) equation and its perturbed versions are well studied. Here we briefly outline how they can be generalized for the higher NLS-type equations and for the multicomponent NLS equations. It is shown that in all these cases the complex Toda chain plays fundamental role.

author.name: V. S. Gerdjikov
author.arxiv:affiliation: Institute for Nuclear Research and Nuclear Energy, Sofia, Bulgaria

entry.title: The SU(n) invariant massive Thirring model with boundary reflection
entry.summary: We study the SU(n) invariant massive Thirring model with boundary reflection. Our approach is based on the free field approach. We construct the free field realizations of the boundary state and its dual. For an application of these realizations, we present integral representations for the form factors of the local operators.

entry.title: On Construction of Recursion Operator and Algebra of Symmetries for Field and Lattice Systems
entry.summary: In the paper, developing the idea of V. Sokolov et all. (J.Math.Phys. 40 (1999)6473 we construct recursion operators and hereditary algebra of symmetries for many field and lattice systems.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, to appear in Rep. Math. Phys

entry.title: On one-parametric families of Backlund transformations
